intro: Duval-jouvea pilosa, commonly known as the hairy duval-jouvea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
